mods.abstract: The Juggler's form is created by bold wide lines, lines which express the lithe movement of the Juggle's action.
mods.note: Print was made by using a thick lithographic crayon and brush and lithographic ink. The three colors used are a light bluish-grey, green and yellow. Ms. Durieux commented that the artist always has a color gratis, that is, the actual color of the paper with which to include in the color planning of a print. In this print the white of the paper serves as accent areas throughout the composition.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art
